intro: Hypochaeris maculata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear cress, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves and small, yellow flowers with four petals. The plant thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, and the flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often considered a weed but has some ornamental value in gardens.
